programme.title: Eat Me (or Try Not To)
programme.desc: Food brands travel around the world, stick around and change the places they visit; once the food is adopted by eager taste buds, it becomes part of local culture and tradition.

programme.title: Eat Me (or Try Not To)
programme.desc: Climate change, a global pandemic, and a booming world population mark an opportune time to be in the food business, not unlike the first wave of the industrial food revolution that gave people the first globally mass-produced, processed foods.

programme.title: Eat Me (or Try Not To)
programme.desc: In under two centuries, favorite food brands span continents and cultures, spur innovation and technology, and forever change the food landscape.

programme.title: Eat Me (or Try Not To)
programme.desc: Food preferences are influenced by dozens of factors, including genetics, environment and habit, but the taste is also about perception; the color, texture and weight of food are as important as the flavor.

programme.title: Eat Me (or Try Not To)
programme.desc: At one point, each and every food brand had to come up with a plan to get people to try them; today, the food and drink marketing industry is worth about $900 billion and growing.

programme.title: Eat Me (or Try Not To)
programme.desc: With every single bite or sip that people take, they participate in one of the most sophisticated journeys around the world ever taken; the global food supply chain is part of an $8 trillion network that produces over 4 billion tons of food annually.

programme.title: Eat Me (or Try Not To)
programme.desc: Food brands travel around the world, stick around and change the places they visit; once the food is adopted by eager taste buds, it becomes part of local culture and tradition.

programme.title: Eat Me (or Try Not To)
programme.desc: Climate change, a global pandemic, and a booming world population mark an opportune time to be in the food business, not unlike the first wave of the industrial food revolution that gave people the first globally mass-produced, processed foods.

programme.title: Eat Me (or Try Not To)

programme.desc: Food preferences are influenced by dozens of factors, including genetics, environment and habit, but the taste is also about perception; the color, texture and weight of food are as important as the flavor.

programme.title: Suppressed Science
programme.desc: Athena links herself to a robot hand endowed with a delicate sense of touch and gets a sneak peak at unreleased consumer products which promise to optimize our brainwaves.

programme.title: Suppressed Science
programme.desc: Discussing governments around the world outlawing a class of substances which have been used safely by humans for thousands of years.

programme.title: Suppressed Science
programme.sub-title: Race: Science, Social Construct, or Both?
programme.desc: The concept of race was invented during colonial and imperialist eras as a means to reify political power structures.

programme.title: Suppressed Science
programme.sub-title: Weather Control: The Debate Over Geo-Engineering
programme.desc: Human interference with the environment has led people to the brink of an extinction-level climate-change crisis.

programme.title: Suppressed Science
programme.desc: From a cutting-edge, science-based gym, to a medical clinic that offers direct ultrasound brain stimulation designed to increase mental performance.

programme.title: Suppressed Science
programme.desc: The discovery of CRISPR Cas-9 in 2012 opened up limitless potential in the field of genetic editing.

programme.title: Suppressed Science
programme.desc: Athena decodes some of the difficulties faced by the scientists and environmentalists looking to fundamentally change the relationship with energy.

programme.title: Suppressed Science
programme.desc: Over the centuries, scientific theories have emerged that rival religious cosmology in terms of ambition and scope.

programme.title: Becoming Martian
programme.desc: The journey to the neighboring planet traces a path connecting Nikola Tesla, Nazi weapons of war, a Cold War space race, and a string of blockbuster discoveries made by some of NASA's most talented robots.

programme.title: Becoming Martian
programme.desc: Science may soon make the dream of traveling to Mars a reality.

programme.title: Becoming Martian
programme.desc: Evolutionary biologist Dr. Scott Solomon foresees a series of changes to our species from the size of our hearts and heads to the pigments in our skin.

programme.title: Living Universe
programme.desc: Humans have acquired the knowledge that every star in the sky is orbited by at least one planet, and over a quarter of those planets have the right conditions for life.

programme.title: Living Universe
programme.desc: Project engineers revolutionize propulsion technology, navigation, and AI, then set their sights on the exoplanet Minerva B near Mars.
